translated: The vajra action is the nature of the transformation of the five faculties of faith and so on, because it is the cause of the intuition of accomplishment, and because it is the cause of the intuition of accomplishment that is the nature of the transformation of the five faculties of faith and so on.üîΩThe vajra mind is the nature of the transformation of the foundation consciousness, because it is the cause of the intuition of the mind, and because it is the cause of the intuition of the mind that is the nature of the transformation of the foundation consciousness.üîΩThe vajra body is the nature of the transformation of the body, because it is the cause of the intuition of the vajra body, and because it is the cause of the intuition of the vajra body that is the nature of the transformation of the body.

translated: Since it turns away from observing the nature of all phenomena, it has the nature of the emptiness of nature. analyzed: de la yang bcom ldan 'das kyis yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'dod chags rnam pa dgu ni chen po stong pa nyid du bstan te / 'di lta ste / dbyibs la chags pa dang / reg pa la chags pa dang / tsandan la sogs pa bskus pa las byung ba'i lus kyi dri la chags pa dang / rgyan gyis brgyan pa las byung ba'i lus mdzes pa la chags pa dang / lus kyi kha dog la chags pa dang /
translated: Sutra in the section on emptiness of great emptiness.

original: sha rgyas pa la chags pa dang / lus dang yan lag gi rtse 'jo la chags pa dang / so mdzes pa las byung ba'i chags pa dang / kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa'o //
analyzed: sha rgyas pa la chags pa dang / lus dang yan lag gi rtse 'jo la chags pa dang / so mdzes pa las byung ba'i chags pa dang / kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa'o //
translated: They are attachment to shape, attachment to touch, attachment to the smell of the body arising from anointment with sandalwood and so on, attachment to the beauty of the body arising from adornment with ornaments, attachment to the color of the body, attachment to the flesh of the body, attachment to the playfulness of the body and limbs, attachment arising from beautiful teeth and attachment to color and shape.

original: de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i mi gtsang ba yang rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i mi gtsang ba yang rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: The antidotes to those are the nine types of impurity.

original: de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dbyibs la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: dbyibs la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to shape is the ideation of a bloated corpse.

original: lus kyi reg pa la chags pa'i ni 'bus gzhigs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: lus kyi reg pa la chags pa'i ni 'bus gzhigs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the touch of the body is the perception of being eaten by worms.

original: lus kyi dri la chags ba'i ni rnam par rul ba'i 'du shes so //üîΩlus mdzes pa la chags pa'i ni rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: lus kyi dri la chags ba'i ni rnam par rul ba'i 'du shes so // lus mdzes pa la chags pa'i ni rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the smell of the body is the perception of complete decay.üîΩThe antidote to attachment to the beauty of the body is the perception of complete redness.

original: lus kyi kha dog la chags pa'i ni rnam par bsngos pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: lus kyi kha dog la chags pa'i ni rnam par bsngos pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the color of the body is the perception of complete blackness.

original: sha rgyas pa la chags pa'i ni rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: sha rgyas pa la chags pa'i ni rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the plumpness of the body is the perception of being devoured.

original: lus dang yan lag gi rtse 'jo la chags pa'i ni rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: lus dang yan lag gi rtse 'jo la chags pa'i ni rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the play of the body and its limbs is the perception of being scattered.

original: so'i mdzes pa la chags pa'i ni rus gong gi 'du shes so //
analyzed: so'i mdzes pa la chags pa'i ni rus gong gi 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the beauty of the teeth is the perception of the skeleton.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa'i gnyen po ni rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa'i gnyen po ni rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to color and shape is the perception of being burned.

original: zhe sdang las byung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po ni byams pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang las byung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po ni byams pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The antidote to distraction arising from hatred is the cultivation of loving kindness.

original: gti mug las byung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: The antidote to distraction arising from delusion is the cultivation of dependent origination.

original: gang gi tshe sems der mngon par mi dga' bar mthong ba de'i tshe ting nge @61b 'dzin gyi yon tan la bsam pa dang / mi dga' ba'i skyon la bsam pas de yang zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems der mngon par mi dga' bar mthong ba de'i tshe ting nge @61b 'dzin gyi yon tan la bsam pa dang / mi dga' ba'i skyon la bsam pas de yang zhi bar bya'o //
translated: When you see that the mind is not pleased with that, then you should pacify that by reflecting on the virtues of meditative concentration and by reflecting on the faults of non-delight.

original: gang gi tshe gnyid dang rmugs pa las sems zhum par mthong ba de'i tshe snang ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yid la byed pas zhum pa de yang zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyid dang rmugs pa las sems zhum par mthong ba de'i tshe snang ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yid la byed pas zhum pa de yang zhi bar bya'o //
translated: When you see that the mind is slack due to sleepiness and lethargy, then you should pacify that by cultivating the perception of light and by bringing to mind the joyfulness that comes from bringing to mind the virtues of the Buddha and so forth.

original: yang gang gi tshe sngon dgod pa dang / rtse zhing dga' ba rjes su dran pas sems bar skabs su rgod par mthong ba de'i tshe mi rtag pa yid la byed pas de yang zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe sngon dgod pa dang / rtse zhing dga' ba rjes su dran pas sems bar skabs su rgod par mthong ba de'i tshe mi rtag pa yid la byed pas de yang zhi bar bya'o //
translated: When you see that the mind is agitated in between due to recollecting past laughter, play, and joy, then you should pacify that by bringing to mind impermanence.

original: yang gang gi tshe zhum pa dang / rgod pa dag dang bral ba nyid kyis cha mnyam par 'jug cing sems rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas par mthong ba de'i tshe bsgrim pa dang glod pas btang snyoms su byas te /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe zhum pa dang / rgod pa dag dang bral ba nyid kyis cha mnyam par 'jug cing sems rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas par mthong ba de'i tshe bsgrim pa dang glod pas btang snyoms su byas te /
translated: When you see that your mind is evenly engaged, free from laxity and excitement, and is abiding in its own character, then you should be indifferent, neither tightening nor relaxing your mind.

original: gal te sems mnyam par 'jug tu zin kyang bsgrim pa byas na /
analyzed: gal te sems mnyam par 'jug tu zin kyang bsgrim pa byas na /
translated: If you tighten your mind when it is already engaged evenly, then it will become distracted.

original: de'i tshe sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you relax your mind when it is not yet pacified, then laxity will occur.üîΩLaziness, forgetting the object of meditation,

original: le lo dang ni dmigs pa brjed pa dang // de bzhin zhum rgod mi rtsol ba dang rtsol //
analyzed: le lo dang ni dmigs pa brjed pa dang // de bzhin zhum rgod mi rtsol ba dang rtsol //
translated: laxity, excitement, non-application, and application

original: ting nge 'dzin la thams cad nyes par 'gyur //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la thams cad nyes par 'gyur //
translated: are faults for all meditative concentrations.

original: dad sogs sems nyid de yi gnyen po yin //
analyzed: dad sogs sems nyid de yi gnyen po yin //
translated: Faith and so forth are the antidotes to these.

original: mdor na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nyes pa nyid ni rnam pa drug yod de /
analyzed: mdor na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nyes pa nyid ni rnam pa drug yod de /
translated: In brief, there are six faults for all meditative concentrations:

original: 'di lta ste le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang / zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang / bsgrims pa dang / ma bsgrims pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang / zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang / bsgrims pa dang / ma bsgrims pa'o //
translated: laziness, forgetting the object of meditation, laxity, excitement, tightening, and relaxing.

original: de rnams kyi gnyen por spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgom par bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyen por spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgom par bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The antidote to those is the cultivation of the eight applications of abandoning.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The eight applications of abandoning are:

original: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / shin tu spyangs pa dang dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang snyoms dang / sems pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / shin tu spyangs pa dang dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang snyoms dang / sems pa'o //
translated: faith, aspiration, effort, pliancy, mindfulness, vigilance, equanimity, and intention.

original: de la dang po bzhi ni le lo'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: de la dang po bzhi ni le lo'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: The first four are antidotes to laziness.

original: de yang ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan rnams la mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dad pas rnal 'byor pa rnams de la mngon par 'dod pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan rnams la mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dad pas rnal 'byor pa rnams de la mngon par 'dod pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Faith, which has the characteristic of clear belief in the good qualities of samƒÅdhi, gives rise to the mind that aspires to those qualities.

original: mngon par 'dod pa de las rtsol ba rtsom par 'gyur ro //üîΩde las kyang lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa de las rtsol ba rtsom par 'gyur ro // de las kyang lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid thob par 'gyur la /
translated: Aspiration initiates effort.üîΩFrom that, pliancy is attained, which is physical and mental flexibility.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa de las lus dang sems le lo las ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa de las lus dang sems le lo las ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: From pliancy, body and mind turn away from laziness.

original: de bas na dad pa la sogs pa ni le lo spang ba'i phyir @62a * //
analyzed: de bas na dad pa la sogs pa ni le lo spang ba'i phyir @62a * //
translated: Therefore faith and so on are the antidotes to laziness.üîΩ

original: bsgom par bya'o //üîΩdran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o // dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Therefore, faith, etc. should be cultivated in order to eliminate laziness.üîΩRecollection is the antidote to the forgetting of the meditative object.

original: shes bzhin ni zhum pa dang / rgod pa'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni zhum pa dang / rgod pa'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: Intellect is the antidote to slackness and excitedness,

original: des zhum pa dang / rgod pa dag nye bar shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des zhum pa dang / rgod pa dag nye bar shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by means of it one recognizes slackness and excitedness.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa ma zhi ba'i dus su ni mi rtsol ba nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa ma zhi ba'i dus su ni mi rtsol ba nyes pa yin te /
translated: When slackness and excitedness are not pacified, non-exertion is a fault.

original: de'i gnyen por ni sems pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ni sems pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The antidote to that is the cultivation of intention.

original: zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang / nye bar zhi bar gyur nas gang gi tshe sems rang gi rgyun gyis 'jug pa de'i tshe ni rtsol ba nyes pa yin pas de'i gnyen por btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang / nye bar zhi bar gyur nas gang gi tshe sems rang gi rgyun gyis 'jug pa de'i tshe ni rtsol ba nyes pa yin pas de'i gnyen por btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When slackness, excitedness, and pacification have occurred, and at whatever time the mind engages in its own continuum, then exertion is a fault. The antidote to that is the cultivation of equanimity.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po de dang yang dag par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang gis rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan rdzogs par byed par mchog tu las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po de dang yang dag par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang gis rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan rdzogs par byed par mchog tu las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Concentration endowed with the eight formative factors that facilitate relinquishment is the supreme basis for the perfection of qualities such as the supernormal powers and so forth.

original: de bas na mdo las spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba sgom par byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mdo las spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba sgom par byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the s≈´tras, it is said that one meditates on the basis of supernormal power that is endowed with the eight formative factors that facilitate relinquishment.

original: bsgom pa'i rim pa 'di nyid las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pa 'di nyid las dgongs nas /
translated: With this very process of meditation in mind,

original: bcom ldan 'das yum las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yum las /
translated: the Transcendent Conqueror's Mother states:

original: de la sems mnyam par gzhag par bya /üîΩyang dag par 'jog par byed /
analyzed: de la sems mnyam par gzhag par bya / yang dag par 'jog par byed /
translated: Here, one should settle the mind,üîΩcorrectly settle it,

original: rnam par 'jog par byed /üîΩnye bar 'jog par byed /
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par byed / nye bar 'jog par byed /
translated: fully settle it,üîΩclosely settle it,

original: dul bar byed /üîΩzhi bar byed /
analyzed: dul bar byed / zhi bar byed /
translated: tame it,üîΩpacify it,

original: nye bar zhi bar byed /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar byed /
translated: completely pacify it,

original: gcig pa nyid du byed /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du byed /
translated: unify it,

original: ting nge 'dzin du byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and concentrate it.

original: yang dag par 'jog pa ni dmigs pa de nyid la rgyun gyis 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'jog pa ni dmigs pa de nyid la rgyun gyis 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Correct settling is the continuous engagement with that very object.

original: rnam par 'jog pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba shes par byas te de nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba shes par byas te de nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: Determination is the knowledge of distraction and the pacification of it.

original: nye bar 'jog par byed pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba nye bar zhi bar byas nas /
analyzed: nye bar 'jog par byed pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba nye bar zhi bar byas nas /
translated: Placing is the pacification of distraction.

original: de nyid la gong nas gong du gtong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gong nas gong du gtong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Having pacified distraction, one elevates the mind to higher and higher levels.

original: dul bar byed pa ni dga' ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dul bar byed pa ni dga' ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Subduing is the production of joy.

original: zhi bar byed pa ni mi dga' ba nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhi bar byed pa ni mi dga' ba nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: Pacifying is the pacification of the absence of joy.

original: nye bar zhi bar byed pa na gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pa byung ba sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar byed pa na gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pa byung ba sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Completely pacifying is the removal of drowsiness, lethargy, etc.

original: gcig pa nyid du byed pa ni dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug par 'bad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du byed pa ni dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug par 'bad par byed pa'o //
translated: Unifying is the effort to enter into the object without the manifest activity of the mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin du mnyam par 'jog pa ni sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa la btang snyoms su byed pas yang dag par 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du mnyam par 'jog pa ni sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa la btang snyoms su byed pas yang dag par 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Equanimity is the attainment of the equality of mind and the correct retention of it by means of equanimity.

original: tshig dgu po 'di dag gi bshad pa ni /
analyzed: tshig dgu po 'di dag gi bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of these nine terms is as follows.

original: slob dpon thogs @62b med kyis mdzad pa las bris pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon thogs @62b med kyis mdzad pa las bris pa yin no //
translated: This is written from the treatise composed by Master Asa·πÖga.

original: yang rim pa 'dis ting nge 'dzin rdzogs pa gang gi tshe 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang rim pa 'dis ting nge 'dzin rdzogs pa gang gi tshe 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, at what point is the perfection of samƒÅdhi attained by this process?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gang tshe sems ni rtsol ba med pas ni //
analyzed: gang tshe sems ni rtsol ba med pas ni //
translated: When the mind, through non-effort,

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug par gyur pa nas //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug par gyur pa nas //
translated: naturally engages,

original: de tshe sangs rgyas mnyam 'jog la brten te //
analyzed: de tshe sangs rgyas mnyam 'jog la brten te //
translated: then, relying on the Buddha's equipoise,

original: 'di ni ting 'dzin kun gyi tshul yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ting 'dzin kun gyi tshul yin no //
translated: this is the method of all samƒÅdhis.

original: gang gi tshe dmigs pa de mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa ji srid 'dod pas sems gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe zhi gnas rdzogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dmigs pa de mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa ji srid 'dod pas sems gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe zhi gnas rdzogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: When that object is engaged without manifest effort, and the mind abides as long as desired, at that time ≈õamatha is perfected.

original: de ltar mnyam 'jog shes nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam 'jog shes nas ni //
translated: Knowing thus the equipoise,

original: de nas shes rab bskyed bya ste //
analyzed: de nas shes rab bskyed bya ste //
translated: then wisdom should be generated,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med dbye ba yin //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med dbye ba yin //
translated: divided into form and formless.

original: don de nyid ni rnam dpyad bya //
analyzed: don de nyid ni rnam dpyad bya //
translated: That meaning should be analyzed.

original: de la re zhig gzugs can nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig gzugs can nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
translated: First, form itself should be analyzed.

original: ci sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'di dag rnam par shes pa las tha mi dad pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'di dag rnam par shes pa las tha mi dad pa yin nam /
translated: Are these aspects such as blue and so on undifferentiated from consciousness?üîΩOr are they differentiated from consciousness?

original: tha dad pa yin de la shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid yin na /üîΩkhams gsum de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin de la shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid yin na / khams gsum de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: If they are undifferentiated from consciousness,üîΩthe three realms would have the nature of mind, because everything is the entity of mind.

original: thams cad sems kyi dngos po nyid du ni rang na gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig pa nyid du mthong ba de yang shes pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad sems kyi dngos po nyid du ni rang na gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig pa nyid du mthong ba de yang shes pa yin te /
translated: Since blue and so on are seen to be the same entity as consciousness, they are consciousness.

original: de las gzhan nye bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de las gzhan nye bar mi dmigs so //
translated: Nothing other than that is observed.

original: der ni 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: der ni 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, this would be the consequence:

original: gang yang mdun na gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gang yang mdun na gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
translated: Although blue and so on that exist in front are indeed the nature of consciousness,

original: 'on kyang de ni yul dang dus la sogs pa'i nges pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas phyi'i don du brtags pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni yul dang dus la sogs pa'i nges pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas phyi'i don du brtags pa yin no zhe na /
translated: since it is untenable that they are ascertained as other objects, time, and so on, they are imputed to be external objects.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: dam pa blo yi nges pa yang //
analyzed: dam pa blo yi nges pa yang //
translated: The ascertainment of the mind of the wise

original: nang gi rgyu las grub par 'dod //
analyzed: nang gi rgyu las grub par 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be established from internal causes.

original: nang gi shes par byed pa nyid yul dang dus kyi nges bar rigs kyi don gyi dbang gis med pas phyi rol du rtog pa ni legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nang gi shes par byed pa nyid yul dang dus kyi nges bar rigs kyi don gyi dbang gis med pas phyi rol du rtog pa ni legs pa ma yin no //
translated: The internal cognition itself is not restricted to a particular object and time, because of the power of the object. Therefore, it is not good to imagine it as external.

original: ci'i phyi rol la sa ma yin no zhes gal te zer na /
analyzed: ci'i phyi rol la sa ma yin no zhes gal te zer na /
translated: If someone asks, ‚ÄúWhy is it not external?‚Äù

original: byed pa las gzhan du mi 'thad par de nyid brtag par byas la /
analyzed: byed pa las gzhan du mi 'thad par de nyid brtag par byas la /
translated: It is not tenable as anything other than the activity. That should be investigated.

original: de yang phyi rol pa nyid du brtag bar bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de yang phyi rol pa nyid du brtag bar bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: And is that not to be investigated as external?

original: de ni ma yin te thams cad ma dmigs pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te thams cad ma dmigs pa nyid kyis te /
translated: No, because of the non-apprehension of everything.

original: gal te cung zad cig mthong ba ni brtag tu zad na ma mthong ba brtag pa yin na rta'i rva la sogs pa yang shes par byed pa nyid du zhes pas thal ches pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te cung zad cig mthong ba ni brtag tu zad na ma mthong ba brtag pa yin na rta'i rva la sogs pa yang shes par byed pa nyid du zhes pas thal ches pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If something is seen, it can be investigated. But if it is not seen, it is investigated as non-existent. Then it would follow, absurdly, that even the horn of a rabbit would be apprehended.

original: rta'i rva la sogs pa ni med pas @63a * //
analyzed: rta'i rva la sogs pa ni med pas @63a * //
translated: The horn of a rabbit and so on do not exist.

original: zhen pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: zhen pa med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is no attachment to them.

original: phyi rol ci ltar yod /
analyzed: phyi rol ci ltar yod /
translated: How can the external exist?

original: nges pa gzhan du mi dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa gzhan du mi dmigs so zhe na /
translated: It is not apprehended as anything other than that.

original: rta'i rva la sogs pa dang mnyam pa dang gcig la gcig bsten pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rta'i rva la sogs pa dang mnyam pa dang gcig la gcig bsten pa nyid kyis so //
translated: because they are equal to the horn of a rabbit, etc., and because they are mutually dependent.

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pa las mthong ba nyid yin na gzhan nyid du gyur pa na 'gro ba rnams ni 'o na long gyur ;
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pa las mthong ba nyid yin na gzhan nyid du gyur pa na 'gro ba rnams ni 'o na long gyur ;
translated: If it is seen that it is not tenable that they are different, then when they become different, the goers would be blind.

original: mi snang ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi snang ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they would have the nature of being invisible.

original: 'gro rnams long bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro rnams long bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the goers would be blind.

original: snang bar byed pa de sems kyi rang bzhin can gzhan zhig par gyur pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: snang bar byed pa de sems kyi rang bzhin can gzhan zhig par gyur pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it that the nature of the goer is the mind, and that the mind is not blind?

original: de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir sems kyi rang bzhin ngag yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir sems kyi rang bzhin ngag yod pa ma yin na /
translated: That is not so, because the nature of the mind does not exist.

original: 'di gang na yod /
analyzed: 'di gang na yod /
translated: Where does it exist?

original: gang mngon sum du yang med la rjes su dpag par yang med de /
analyzed: gang mngon sum du yang med la rjes su dpag par yang med de /
translated: It is neither directly perceived nor inferred.

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang tha dad pa dang sems kyi ngo bo gzhan dag 'di ni mngon sum du mi snang la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang tha dad pa dang sems kyi ngo bo gzhan dag 'di ni mngon sum du mi snang la /
translated: The nature of the mind that is different from blue, etc., is not directly perceived.

original: de rjes su dpag par yang med de /
analyzed: de rjes su dpag par yang med de /
translated: Nor is it inferred.

original: de mngon sum 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is directly perceived by the goer.

original: yang na bde ba la sogs pa'i tshul du gzugs la sogs pa nye bar dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: yang na bde ba la sogs pa'i tshul du gzugs la sogs pa nye bar dmigs so zhe na /
translated: Or do you observe form, etc. in the manner of pleasure, etc.?

original: de ni ma yin /
analyzed: de ni ma yin /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir gzung bar bya ba las bye brag med pa nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa'i tshul ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung bar bya ba las bye brag med pa nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa'i tshul ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not in the manner of pleasure, etc. due to the absence of distinction from the object of apprehension.üîΩBecause error, etc. are objects of apprehension in the manner of internal tactile objects, their distinction is not established as a distinction of the object of apprehension.

original: 'khrul pa la sogs pa nang gi reg bya'i tshul nyid kyis gzung bya yin pa'i phyir de'i khyad par gyis kyang gzung bar bya ba'i khyad par du mi 'grub pa dang / 'on te mngon sum du dmigs su med kyang don gyi dbang gis nye bar dmigs te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa la sogs pa nang gi reg bya'i tshul nyid kyis gzung bya yin pa'i phyir de'i khyad par gyis kyang gzung bar bya ba'i khyad par du mi 'grub pa dang / 'on te mngon sum du dmigs su med kyang don gyi dbang gis nye bar dmigs te /
translated: Or, although not directly observed, it is observed by the power of the object.

original: de yang don mi shes pa la gang yang blo'i dmigs pa mi skye ba'i shes pa la rjes su dpag pa nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang don mi shes pa la gang yang blo'i dmigs pa mi skye ba'i shes pa la rjes su dpag pa nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do zhe na /
translated: And that is explained as inference being observed in consciousness that does not know the object.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan du 'thad pa ma yin pa sems kyi tshul du zad par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan du 'thad pa ma yin pa sems kyi tshul du zad par 'gyur /
translated: Because it is not tenable otherwise, it is exhausted in the manner of the mind.

original: sems kyi tshul ma yin pa nyid kyis bems po yin pas na so sor snang ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi tshul ma yin pa nyid kyis bems po yin pas na so sor snang ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not the mode of mind, it is insentient, and therefore it has a separate appearance.

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pas 'dzin pa po'i char yongs su gdags par gyur pa ni srid kyi tshul nyid du de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pas 'dzin pa po'i char yongs su gdags par gyur pa ni srid kyi tshul nyid du de mi 'thad do //
translated: Since it is not tenable as anything else, it is designated as the apprehending aspect, but it is not tenable as the mode of mind.

original: bems po nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gzhan du mi 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bems po nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gzhan du mi 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not tenable as anything else because it is insentient,

original: de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: that is not so, because

original: phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa ni //
analyzed: phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa ni //
translated: the fault of mutual dependence

original: tshangs pas kyang ni bzlog mi nus //
analyzed: tshangs pas kyang ni bzlog mi nus //
translated: cannot be averted even by BrahmƒÅ.

original: gzhan du mi rigs pa ni 'dzin pa po'i char yongs su brtags pas /
analyzed: gzhan du mi rigs pa ni 'dzin pa po'i char yongs su brtags pas /
translated: Since it is not tenable as anything else, it is imputed as the apprehending aspect.

original: bems po dang bems po ma yin pa gzhan @63b pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bems po dang bems po ma yin pa gzhan @63b pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that it is different from the insentient and the mode of mind.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig pu nyid du mthong gi de las tha dad pa'i bems po'am sems kyi tshul bzhin ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bye brag gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig pu nyid du mthong gi de las tha dad pa'i bems po'am sems kyi tshul bzhin ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bye brag gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that only the aspects such as blue are seen, and apart from that, the insentient or the mode of mind does not exist.

original: de'i phyir nye bar brtag pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar brtag pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, this investigation

original: sems tsam la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni brten nas su //
translated: is based on mind only.

original: phyi rol don la mi rtag go //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol don la mi rtag go // zhes pa ste /
translated: External objects do not exist.

original: phyi rol med pas gzung bar bya ba med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa po'i rnam par shes pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol med pas gzung bar bya ba med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa po'i rnam par shes pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Since external objects do not exist, the apprehending consciousness also does not exist because there is no object to be apprehended.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin nyid la gnas nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis sems tsam spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin nyid la gnas nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis sems tsam spang bar bya'o //
translated: Abiding in reality free from the aspects of apprehended and apprehender, the mode of nonduality, one should abandon mind only, the mode of apprehended and apprehender.

original: de yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: de bzhin nyid du dmigs nas su //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du dmigs nas su //
translated: Having observed reality,

original: sems tsam nyid kyang bzla bar bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems tsam nyid kyang bzla bar bya // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: one should transcend even mind only.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / rnam par shes la brten nas su //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam par shes la brten nas su //
translated: based on consciousness,

original: phyi yi don ni yongs su spang //
analyzed: phyi yi don ni yongs su spang //
translated: external objects are completely abandoned.

original: stong nyid dmigs pa la gnas nas //
analyzed: stong nyid dmigs pa la gnas nas //
translated: Abiding in the observation of emptiness,

original: 'dzin byed cha yang spang bar bya //
analyzed: 'dzin byed cha yang spang bar bya //
translated: even the aspect of apprehender is abandoned.

original: de ltar na tshul rnam pa gnyi ga dang bral bas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can gyi sems kyi tshul ni 'gro ba yin no zhes nges par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar na tshul rnam pa gnyi ga dang bral bas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can gyi sems kyi tshul ni 'gro ba yin no zhes nges par byas nas /
translated: Thus, the nature of mind, which is empty of both of these modes, is the nature of the world.

original: yang de nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang de nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Having ascertained this, one should analyze it further.

original: ci ste gcig pa'am du ma'am gnyi ga'i tshul can nam /
analyzed: ci ste gcig pa'am du ma'am gnyi ga'i tshul can nam /
translated: Is it singular, plural, or both?

original: skyes pa'am ma skyes pa yin /
analyzed: skyes pa'am ma skyes pa yin /
translated: Is it arisen or non-arisen?

original: skyes na bdag las sam gzhan las sam gnyi ga las sam /
analyzed: skyes na bdag las sam gzhan las sam gnyi ga las sam /
translated: If it is arisen, is it arisen from itself, from another, or from both?

original: rgyu med pa las skye /üîΩde bzhin du dngos po'i tshul can nam /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skye / de bzhin du dngos po'i tshul can nam /
translated: Or is it arisen without a cause?üîΩIn the same way, is it a mode of being an entity?

original: dngos po med pa'i tshul can yin //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshul can yin //
translated: Or is it a mode of being a non-entity?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpyad par bya'o //
translated: One should analyze it in this way.

original: de la re zhig /'gro ba sna tshogs nyid yin phyir //
analyzed: de la re zhig /'gro ba sna tshogs nyid yin phyir //
translated: Regarding this, first:

original: gcig nyid ma yin du ma'ang min //
analyzed: gcig nyid ma yin du ma'ang min //
translated: It is not singular, nor is it plural,üîΩBecause of the very diversity of the world.

original: sems kyi tshul yang mi shes pas //
analyzed: sems kyi tshul yang mi shes pas //
translated: Since one does not even understand the mode of mind,

original: de phyir gnyi ga'i tshul nyid min //
analyzed: de phyir gnyi ga'i tshul nyid min //
translated: It is not both.

original: skye ba min na 'gag pa min //
analyzed: skye ba min na 'gag pa min //
translated: If it is not arisen, it does not cease.

original: 'gro ba dngos dang dngos med min //
analyzed: 'gro ba dngos dang dngos med min //
translated: The world is neither an entity nor a non-entity.

original: rang nyid chos sku'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: rang nyid chos sku'i bdag nyid can //
translated: You are the nature of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: de la re zhig gcig pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gcig pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: First, they are not the same.

original: gal te gcig tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gcig tu 'gyur na /
translated: If they were the same,

original: sngon po ser po la sogs pa'i tshul gyis sna tshogs par snang ba'i shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po ser po la sogs pa'i tshul gyis sna tshogs par snang ba'i shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: consciousness would not appear as various things, such as blue, yellow, and so on.

original: ser po la sogs pa ma lus pa sngon po'i nang du shes par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa ma lus pa sngon po'i nang du shes par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that all of yellow and so on would be cognized as blue.

original: sngon po yang sngon dang / phyi ma dang dbus kyi dbye ba dang rigs par snang bas shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po yang sngon dang / phyi ma dang dbus kyi dbye ba dang rigs par snang bas shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Blue would not be cognized as appearing in parts, such as front, back, and middle.

original: gang la phyogs kyi cha yod pa de la ni gcig @64a * //
analyzed: gang la phyogs kyi cha yod pa de la ni gcig @64a * //
translated: It is not tenable that something that has parts is one.

original: pa nyid du mi 'thad par bya ba'i rigs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: pa nyid du mi 'thad par bya ba'i rigs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: This is because it is reasonable to analyze it.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab tsam nyid du so sor snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab tsam nyid du so sor snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would appear as just the subtle particle.

original: du ma nyid du yang ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma nyid du yang ma yin te /
translated: They are also not many.

original: du ma nyid yin na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i stong ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na nyid la rdul phra rab dbye ba med pa dang de las gzhan pa'i yang dag pa med pas rdul phra rab re re zhing rang rig
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i stong ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na nyid la rdul phra rab dbye ba med pa dang de las gzhan pa'i yang dag pa med pas rdul phra rab re re zhing rang rig
translated: If it is manifold, then in the nature of suchness, which is emptiness free from apprehended and apprehender, there are no indivisible particles, and apart from that there is no reality, so each particle is reflexive awareness.üîΩ

original: pa'i tshul gyis de nyid rdul phra rab tha dad par snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i tshul gyis de nyid rdul phra rab tha dad par snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is manifold, then the nature of reality, which is emptiness free from the apprehended and the apprehender, is not a partless subtle particle, and since there is no other reality, it follows that each subtle particle would be that very reality, appearing as a different subtle particle in the manner of reflexive awareness.

original: gnyi ga'i tshul du yang mi rigs te de lta bu'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthams cad du kho bo cag gi tshad ma ni mngon sum pa yin na rjes su 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i tshul du yang mi rigs te de lta bu'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro // thams cad du kho bo cag gi tshad ma ni mngon sum pa yin na rjes su 'jug pa'am /
translated: It is also not tenable for it to be both, because such a consciousness does not exist.

original: ldog pa'i tshul du lhan cig gam tha dad par mngon sum du shes pa nye bar ma dmigs so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshul du lhan cig gam tha dad par mngon sum du shes pa nye bar ma dmigs so //
translated: In all cases, our valid knowledge is direct perception, but we do not observe a direct perception of a positive or negative concomitance in terms of simultaneity or difference.

original: de las gzhan pa yang de sngon du 'gro ba yin pas ma la de ltar ma dmigs na rjes su 'jug pa dang / ldog pa tshad med par ji ltar yongs su brtag par bya ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yang de sngon du 'gro ba yin pas ma la de ltar ma dmigs na rjes su 'jug pa dang / ldog pa tshad med par ji ltar yongs su brtag par bya ;
translated: Since other things also are preceded by that, if it is not observed in that way, how could a positive or negative concomitance be imagined without valid knowledge?

original: 'on te sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rigs pa'i rnam par rang gi shes pa'i tshul gyis smyon tol bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rigs pa'i rnam par rang gi shes pa'i tshul gyis smyon tol bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Or is it that the various [appearances] are to be understood as the mode of one's own consciousness? It is not reasonable to act like a madman.

original: re zhig gzhan dgag pa'i tshul gyis yod pa de yang rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gzhan dgag pa'i tshul gyis yod pa de yang rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: First, even that existence by the mode of negation of other is not without engagement and disengagement.

original: de ni de'i ngo bo nyid las gzhan du mi 'thad par yongs su brtag par bya'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i ngo bo nyid las gzhan du mi 'thad par yongs su brtag par bya'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: That should be thoroughly investigated as not being tenable as other than its own nature.

original: nyams su myong ba'i tshul nyid kyis spros pa med pas de shin tu gsal bar 'thad pas don gyis shes par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i tshul nyid kyis spros pa med pas de shin tu gsal bar 'thad pas don gyis shes par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not so, because it is very clear that it is tenable without conceptual elaborations by the mode of experience itself, since there is no object to be understood by the meaning [of the words].

original: de nyid kyis na skye ba'ang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na skye ba'ang mi rigs te /
translated: By that very [reasoning], arising is also unreasonable,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis tshad ma med pas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis tshad ma med pas so //
translated: because there is no valid cognition by the mode of cause and effect.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i tshul gyis tshad ma la 'jug na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du gzhag pa'i rnam pa gnyis po las rnam par dben pa gnyis su med pa'i shes pa la ni sngon dang phyi ma'i 'jug pa dang ldan pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i tshul gyis tshad ma la 'jug na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du gzhag pa'i rnam pa gnyis po las rnam par dben pa gnyis su med pa'i shes pa la ni sngon dang phyi ma'i 'jug pa dang ldan pa ma yin la /
translated: If valid knowledge engages objects in a prior or subsequent manner, then it is excluded from the two modes of positing cause and effect. Nondual consciousness does not have prior or subsequent engagement.

original: de las gzhan pa'i shes pa yod pa ma yin pas tshad ma med par bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i shes pa yod pa ma yin pas tshad ma med par bshad pa yin la /
translated: Since there is no other consciousness, valid knowledge is explained to be nonexistent.üîΩThus, since valid knowledge does not exist in the manner of cause and effect, arising itself does not exist.

original: de ltar gang gi tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis tshad ma med pas skye ba nyid kyang med pa de'i tshe bdag dang gzhan las sam /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis tshad ma med pas skye ba nyid kyang med pa de'i tshe bdag dang gzhan las sam /
translated: Then how could it arise from self, other,

original: gnyi ga las sam /
analyzed: gnyi ga las sam /
translated: both, or

original: rgyu med pa las ga las skye /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las ga las skye /
translated: without a cause?üîΩTherefore, since this analysis shows that all phenomena are not produced, the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna said:üîΩThe view of those who see

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam par dpyad pa 'di nyid kyis chos thams cad skye ba mthong bas slob dpon @64b klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam par dpyad pa 'di nyid kyis chos thams cad skye ba mthong bas slob dpon @64b klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: the perfect truth is thatüîΩall things arise

original: ma rig rkyen las byung ba yi //üîΩyang dag shes pa la lta bas //
analyzed: ma rig rkyen las byung ba yi //üîΩyang dag shes pa la lta bas //
translated: from the condition of ignorance.

original: skye ba'am yang na 'gag pa ni //
analyzed: skye ba'am yang na 'gag pa ni //
translated: Nor is there any arising or ceasing

original: 'ga' yang nye bar ma dmigs so //üîΩzhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' yang nye bar ma dmigs so // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: That is observed in any way.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid la skye ba med pas dngos po'i tshul nyid du yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid la skye ba med pas dngos po'i tshul nyid du yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, since there is no arising in reality, it does not exist even in the manner of things.

original: 'byung pas na dngos po ste yod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'byung ba nyid la rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung pas na dngos po ste yod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'byung ba nyid la rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: For, an entity is posited as that which has arisen, since arising is a prerequisite for existence.

original: de ltar de 'jig pa'i tshul gyi rang bzhin can dngos po med pa'i tshul nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: de ltar de 'jig pa'i tshul gyi rang bzhin can dngos po med pa'i tshul nyid kyang med do //
translated: Thus, since it does not exist in the manner of nonentities, it also does not exist in the manner of entities.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas sgros pa thams cad kyang med pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas sgros pa thams cad kyang med pa yin te /
translated: Since it does not have the nature of an entity or a nonentity, all designations also do not exist.

original: de rnams ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la gnas pa nyid kyis de gnyis khyab pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de rnams ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la gnas pa nyid kyis de gnyis khyab pa yin pa'i phyir te /
