original: de ltar khyab pa po med pas khyab par bya ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar khyab pa po med pas khyab par bya ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the pervader does not exist, the pervaded also does not exist.

original: de bas na rnam par dpyad pa 'dis spros pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid du shes par byas la sems tsam las yongs su bzlas la gcig dang du ma nyid la sogs pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid kyang
analyzed: de bas na rnam par dpyad pa 'dis spros pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid du shes par byas la sems tsam las yongs su bzlas la gcig dang du ma nyid la sogs pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid kyang
translated: Therefore, by this analysis, since there is no conceptual elaboration, one should understand that beings are of the nature of the Dharma Body. Having transcended mere mind, one should also transcend reality

original: snang ba med pa'i tshul du bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i tshul du bzla bar bya'o //
translated: in the manner of oneness and manyness, etc., in the manner of non-appearance.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: sems tsam las ni bzlas nas su //
analyzed: sems tsam las ni bzlas nas su //
translated: having transcended mere mind,

original: snang ba med las bzla bar bya //
analyzed: snang ba med las bzla bar bya //
translated: one should transcend non-appearance.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: spros pa med pa'i tshul yang snang ba med pa la rnam par gnas pa ni de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i tshul yang snang ba med pa la rnam par gnas pa ni de kho na nyid de /
translated: The mode of non-elaboration is abiding in non-appearance, which is reality.

original: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is called the Great Vehicle

original: mtshan gyi rnam pa gzhan du na phyag rgya chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan gyi rnam pa gzhan du na phyag rgya chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: is also called the Great Seal in another name.

original: de mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: de mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni //
translated: Seeing that is said.

original: snang med gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: snang med gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who abides in non-appearance

original: de yis theg pa chen po mthong //
analyzed: de yis theg pa chen po mthong //
translated: sees the Great Vehicle.

original: zhes bya ba dang 'gro dang ldang dang 'dug pa dang // nyal na'ang mnyam par gzhag pa yin //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang 'gro dang ldang dang 'dug pa dang // nyal na'ang mnyam par gzhag pa yin //
translated: he is in meditative equipoise.

original: mthong dang thos dang de bzhin bsgom //
analyzed: mthong dang thos dang de bzhin bsgom //
translated: He meditates on what is seen, heard, and likewise thought,

original: myong dang reg par de bsgom yang //
analyzed: myong dang reg par de bsgom yang //
translated: and on what is touched, felt, and experienced.üîΩThe self, whose eye of wisdom is pure,

original: shes rab mig ni dag pa'i bdag / rnam par dpyod la gcig tu brtson //
analyzed: shes rab mig ni dag pa'i bdag / rnam par dpyod la gcig tu brtson //
translated: is intent on discerning the one.

original: chos rnams thams cad mi shes pas //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad mi shes pas //
translated: Since he does not know all things,

original: mthong na'ang mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong na'ang mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: even though he sees, he does not see.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba 'di nyid ni gang shes rab kyis rnam par brtags na yang dag pa'i ye shes mthong bas chos thams cad mi mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba 'di nyid ni gang shes rab kyis rnam par brtags na yang dag pa'i ye shes mthong bas chos thams cad mi mthong ba yin no //
translated: This seeing of reality is the nonseeing of all things by the seeing of true wisdom, which is the discernment by wisdom.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das yum las /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das yum las /
translated: And that is stated in the Transcendent Wisdom Mother:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi spyan gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi spyan gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the wisdom eye of the transcendent lords, the buddhas?

original: gang gis ci yang ma gzigs @65a * //
analyzed: gang gis ci yang ma gzigs @65a * //
translated: It is that by which nothing is seen.‚Äù

original: pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam pa mthong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam pa mthong ba gang zhe na /
translated: And similarly, ‚ÄúWhat is the seeing of the ultimate?

original: gang chos thams cad mthong ba med pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad mthong ba med pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThat which does not see any phenomenon at all.‚Äù

original: de bas na de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang spyod lam thams cad la gnas pa na chos thams cad mthong du zin kyang ma mthong ba yin no //üîΩde lta bu nyid la mthong ba med pa zhes bya bar mngon par 'dod kyi gnyid log pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang spyod lam thams cad la gnas pa na chos thams cad mthong du zin kyang ma mthong ba yin no // de lta bu nyid la mthong ba med pa zhes bya bar mngon par 'dod kyi gnyid log pa'am /
translated: Therefore, even though the yogi/nis of reality see all phenomena in all situations, they do not see.

original: mig btsums pa dang 'dra bar gang yid la mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig btsums pa dang 'dra bar gang yid la mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They assert that this is ‚Äúnonseeing.‚Äù It is not that they do not pay attention to anything, as if they were asleep or their eyes were closed.

original: de lta na ni bag chags ma spangs pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa las ldang ba bzhin du slar yang gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba nyid
analyzed: de lta na ni bag chags ma spangs pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa las ldang ba bzhin du slar yang gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba nyid
translated: If that were so, since they would not have eliminated the latent propensities, they would again generate attachment and so on, which are rooted in the latent propensities of attachment to form and so on, just as one arises from the meditative attainment of nondiscrimination.

original: kyis rnal 'byor par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kyis rnal 'byor par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They would not be yogis/nis.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa yid la mi byed pa tsam gyis yongs su spangs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa yid la mi byed pa tsam gyis yongs su spangs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Form, etc. are not abandoned merely by not attending to them, since they have been present since beginningless time.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas kyang de spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas kyang de spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are also not abandoned by the attainments of non-perception, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi the tshom ma spangs par de yid la byed pa yongs su spang par yang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi the tshom ma spangs par de yid la byed pa yongs su spang par yang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: One cannot abandon the attention to form, etc. without abandoning doubt about those objects.

original: me yongs su ma spangs par tsha ba spong mi nus pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: me yongs su ma spangs par tsha ba spong mi nus pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the fact that one cannot abandon heat without abandoning fire.

original: de bas na the tshom gyi sa bon dang bral ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa bsal bar bya'i //
analyzed: de bas na the tshom gyi sa bon dang bral ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa bsal bar bya'i //
translated: Therefore, one should remove the attachment to form, etc. by removing the seed of doubt.

original: cher ma byin la lta bur bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: cher ma byin la lta bur bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: It is certain that one should not act like a fool who does not give much.

original: the tshom gyi sa bon dang bral ba yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong phan tshun rjes su mthun par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi sa bon dang bral ba yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong phan tshun rjes su mthun par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: One should also remove the seed of doubt by making tranquility and insight function in mutual harmony.

original: de yang sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi zhi gnas kyi snang ba skyes par gyur na shes rab kyi mig gis rnam par dpyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i the tshom dang bul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi zhi gnas kyi snang ba skyes par gyur na shes rab kyi mig gis rnam par dpyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i the tshom dang bul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when the appearance of ≈õamatha, which has the characteristic of one-pointed mind, arises, the yogin who analyzes with the eye of wisdom will be free from doubt and sluggishness.

original: de dang bral bas gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dang bral bas gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from that, he is free from clinging to form and so on.

original: de dang bral nas kyang chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs te /
analyzed: de dang bral nas kyang chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs te /
translated: Having become free from that, he realizes that all phenomena are unreal.

original: de nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: That itself is the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang de'i tshe zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag de'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: yang de'i tshe zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag de'i bdag nyid can yin te /
translated: Moreover, at that time, ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ have the nature of that [nonconceptual wisdom].

original: de nyid ni mchog tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni mchog tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: That itself is the yoga of supreme nonconceptuality.üîΩAnd that is stated in the following:

original: de yang / kun rtog thams cad spangs pa des //
analyzed: de yang / kun rtog thams cad spangs pa des //
translated: By abandoning all conceptions,

original: 'di ni @65b rnal 'byor dam pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni @65b rnal 'byor dam pa yin //
translated: this is the supreme yoga.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang mngon sum du //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang mngon sum du //
translated: The yogin who abides in the direct

original: gnas pa kun mkhyen bcom ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas pa kun mkhyen bcom ldan 'gyur //
translated: perception of that becomes the omniscient BhagavƒÅn.

original: de ltar rim pa 'dis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gis sam /
analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'dis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gis sam /
translated: Thus, by this process, one should develop wisdom through serenity and insight, or

original: bla ma'i man ngag gis bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab bskyed la /
analyzed: bla ma'i man ngag gis bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab bskyed la /
translated: through the instructions of the guru.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rab dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir de nges pa'i rgyu nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid rtogs par byas la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rab dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir de nges pa'i rgyu nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid rtogs par byas la /
translated: And because the bodhisattva has the highest acumen, one should realize the state of irreversibility by the very cause of that wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Then one should enter into the perfection of wisdom, the essence of the perfection of wisdom, and the method of generosity and so on.

original: de yang 'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri las /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri las /
translated: The noble Gayasirsha Hill Scripture states:

original: gnyis po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' lam mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' lam mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: These two are the brief path of the bodhisattva:

original: 'di lta ste thabs dang shes rab bo zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste thabs dang shes rab bo zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: method and wisdom.

original: thabs ni sbyin ba la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba ste /
analyzed: thabs ni sbyin ba la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba ste /
translated: Method is divided by the categories of the perfections such as generosity, the immeasurables, the means of gathering disciples, and so on.

original: da nyid kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa dang / dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa'i mdo las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: da nyid kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa dang / dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa'i mdo las gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is also taught in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa, Ratnamegha, and other sutras.

original: shes rab ni thabs de nyid phyin ci ma log par yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni thabs de nyid phyin ci ma log par yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Wisdom is the cause of unmistaken discernment of that very method.

original: des kyang thabs yang dag par brtags nas phyin ci ma log pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don ji lta ba bzhin nyams su len pas sngags kyis zin pa'i dug spyod pa dang 'dra bar kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang thabs yang dag par brtags nas phyin ci ma log pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don ji lta ba bzhin nyams su len pas sngags kyis zin pa'i dug spyod pa dang 'dra bar kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And, having examined the method, one practices the benefit of self and other unmistakenly, like the use of poison controlled by mantra, without being defiled by addictions.

original: de yang mdo de nyid las thabs ni bsdu ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mdo de nyid las thabs ni bsdu ba shes pa'o //
translated: And that very sutra says, Method is the knowledge of inclusion.üîΩWisdom is discernment.

original: shes rab ni yongs su gcod pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa las /
analyzed: shes rab ni yongs su gcod pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa las /
translated: And the noble Sadhinirmocana says,

original: thabs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is skill in means?

original: gang chos thams cad kyi bsdu ba shes pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi bsdu ba shes pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: It is skill in the knowledge of the inclusion of all things.

original: shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: gang chos thams cad dbyer med par shes pa mkhas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad dbyer med par shes pa mkhas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One who knows all phenomena to be undifferentiated is wise.

original: 'di dag ni sa la gnas pas kyang brten par bya'i //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sa la gnas pas kyang brten par bya'i //
translated: These should be relied upon by one who is abiding on the stages,

original: shes rab tsam 'ba' zhig gi ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab tsam 'ba' zhig gi ma yin no //
translated: not just by one who has only wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir sa bcu pa la sogs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bcu pa la sogs pa'i mdo las /
translated: Because in the Dashabhumika and other sutras,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la yang i spyod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la yang i spyod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas /
translated: it is said that one does not practice the remaining perfections.

original: byang chub sems adpa' sa bcu po thams cad du yang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la kun du spyod par bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems adpa' sa bcu po thams cad du yang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la kun du spyod par bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the bodhisattva should practice all the perfections on all ten stages.

original: de yang shes rab kyi qpha rol tu phyin pa la gcig @66a * //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi qpha rol tu phyin pa la gcig @66a * //
translated: And it is said that the perfection of wisdom is the most important.

original: tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas yongs su rgyas pa'i mdo chos thams cad bsdus pa las byams pa gang yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par gzung bar bya ba
analyzed: tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas yongs su rgyas pa'i mdo chos thams cad bsdus pa las byams pa gang yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par gzung bar bya ba
translated: In that sutra, the Buddha said, ‚ÄúMaitreya, bodhisattvas should correctly practice the six perfections in order to attain enlightenment.‚Äù

original: de la skyes bu blun po rnams 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la bslab par bya'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams kyis ci zhig dgos zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: de la skyes bu blun po rnams 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la bslab par bya'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams kyis ci zhig dgos zhes zer zhing /
translated: Fools say, ‚ÄúBodhisattvas should only train in the perfection of wisdom. What is the need for the other perfections?‚ÄùüîΩThey think that the other perfections are contemptible.

original: des pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag la smod pa nyid du sems par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: des pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag la smod pa nyid du sems par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: The noble Tantra of the Great Radiant Light says,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di ni snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba can byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyud dang ldan pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di ni snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba can byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyud dang ldan pa /
translated: This gnosis of omniscience has great compassion as its root, is endowed with the continuity of the thought of awakening,

original: thabs kyis mthar phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs kyis mthar phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and is perfected by means.

original: de bas na gnyi ga yang dus thams cad du bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyi ga yang dus thams cad du bsten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, both should be relied upon at all times.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One is established as having a nonabiding nirvana.

original: de yang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis gzugs kyi sku dang zhing dang 'khor la sogs pa'i longs spyod chen po 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin par mdzad pas /
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis gzugs kyi sku dang zhing dang 'khor la sogs pa'i longs spyod chen po 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin par mdzad pas /
translated: Moreover, by means of the methods of generosity and so on, he takes hold of the perfect result, the great enjoyment of the form body, the buddha field, retinue, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par mi mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One does not abide in nirvana.

original: shes rab kyis phyin ci log ma lus par spangs pas 'khor bar gnas par mi mdzad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyis phyin ci log ma lus par spangs pas 'khor bar gnas par mi mdzad de /
translated: By means of wisdom, he abandons all error and therefore does not abide in samsara,

original: 'khor ba ni phyin ci log gi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni phyin ci log gi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because samsara is characterized by error.

original: de yang chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis ni chos rnams kyang spang bar bya na chos ma yin pa lta ci smos zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de yang chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis ni chos rnams kyang spang bar bya na chos ma yin pa lta ci smos zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu yin te /
translated: Moreover, those who know the Dharma to be like a raft should abandon the Dharma, not to mention what is not Dharma.

original: de la phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa nyid spang bar bya'o zhes gsungs kyi dgos pa'i don rdzogs par bya ba'i don du yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa nyid spang bar bya'o zhes gsungs kyi dgos pa'i don rdzogs par bya ba'i don du yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin no //
translated: There it is said that one should abandon the very adherence to the perverse, but it is not said that one should not abide for the sake of completing the purpose of the goal.

original: de yang / chos yongs su gzung bar bya'i mi gzung bar ni mi bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang / chos yongs su gzung bar bya'i mi gzung bar ni mi bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: And it is said that one should uphold the Dharma, but not that one should not uphold it.

original: lam log par gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lam log par gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not uphold a perverse path.

original: de bas na dngos po thams cad de ltar gzigs te gsungs pa ni /üîΩdus kun du ni thabs @66b dang ni //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po thams cad de ltar gzigs te gsungs pa ni / dus kun du ni thabs @66b dang ni //
translated: Therefore, the one who sees and teaches all things in that way

original: shes rab pha rol phyin bdag can //üîΩbsten bya gang phyir de bas ni //üîΩmi gnas mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin bdag can // bsten bya gang phyir de bas ni // mi gnas mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //
translated: Always has recourse to the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.üîΩBecause of that, he does not abide in nirvana.üîΩThe one who has recourse to the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because of that he does not abide in nirvana.

original: de nyid kyis na sbyor zhes bya'i //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sbyor zhes bya'i //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúapplication‚Äù.

original: sems bskyed yin te de yang ni //
analyzed: sems bskyed yin te de yang ni //
translated: The generation of the thought

original: drod sogs dbye ba la brten nas //
analyzed: drod sogs dbye ba la brten nas //
translated: is based on the divisions of heat, etc.

original: rnam pa bzhir ni gnas ma yin //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir ni gnas ma yin //
translated: It is not in the four stages.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin la bslabs pa las sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin la bslabs pa las sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the thought of the stage of penetration called ‚Äúapplication‚Äù is generated from the training in the nature of wisdom and means.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: And that is fourfold:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: drod dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: drod dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog ces bya ste /
translated: heat, summit, patience, and the supreme mundane state.

original: 'di dag ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i bye brag nyid las gyur to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i bye brag nyid las gyur to //
translated: These are based on the differences in meditative concentration.

original: de la dang po'i sems ni snang ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po'i sems ni snang ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: The first thought is the meditative concentration called ‚Äúattainment of light‚Äù.

original: gnyis pa ni snang ba mched pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni snang ba mched pa'o //
translated: The second is the ‚Äúincrease of light‚Äù.

original: gsum pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la phyogs gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la phyogs gcig pa yin no //
translated: The third is the ‚Äúone-sidedness of the meaning of reality‚Äù.

original: bzhi pa ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The fourth is the ‚Äúmeditative concentration without obstacles‚Äù.

original: 'di ni rnam rtog dgu po dag /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam rtog dgu po dag /
translated: These are the nine conceptualizations.

original: re re yongs su spong byed de //
analyzed: re re yongs su spong byed de //
translated: each is abandoned by each.

original: gzung ngang 'dzin pa'i kun rtog gi / dbye bas dmigs pa'i dbye ba nyid //
analyzed: gzung ngang 'dzin pa'i kun rtog gi / dbye bas dmigs pa'i dbye ba nyid //
translated: The classification of the objective supports is just the classification of the discriminations of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin te /
translated: The afflictions of the bodhisattvas are just discriminations.

original: rnam par rtog pa de yang rnam pa du ma ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de yang rnam pa du ma ste /
translated: And those discriminations are of many types.

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya'o //
translated: They are to be abandoned by the path explained below.

original: de la re zhig nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang po skye ba na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis la dmigs pa na dang por gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dgu spong ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang po skye ba na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis la dmigs pa na dang por gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dgu spong ba 'di lta ste /
translated: First, when the first stage of the path of insight arises, and one focuses on both the afflictions and purification, one first abandons nine discriminations of the apprehended.

original: ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos por mi rtog pas so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos por mi rtog pas so //
translated: The discrimination of ignorance is the nondiscrimination of things such as pots.

original: phung por rtog pa dang / ming dang gzugs su rtog pa dang mtha' gnyis su rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: phung por rtog pa dang / ming dang gzugs su rtog pa dang mtha' gnyis su rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: the conception of the aggregates, the conception of name and form, the conception of the two extremes, the conception of not knowing affliction and purification, the conception of not abiding in the noble path,

original: nye bar dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: the conception of the object of observation, the conception of self and so on, and the conception of nonarising and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dgu po rnam par byang ba la dmigs pa spong ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dgu po rnam par byang ba la dmigs pa spong ste /
translated: The second abandons the nine conceptions of apprehended objects that focus on purification.

original: de la rnam par byang ba'i yan lag can phung po dang khams dang skye mched de rtog pa gsum dang / de rnams nyid skye ba'i @67a * //
analyzed: de la rnam par byang ba'i yan lag can phung po dang khams dang skye mched de rtog pa gsum dang / de rnams nyid skye ba'i @67a * //
translated: Therein, the three conceptions of the aggregates, constituents, and bases that are the branches of purification, and those very three that are the bases of the conception of self,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: the conceptualization of the emptiness of internal phenomena and so on, the conceptualization of the perfections and so on, the conceptualization of the path of seeing, the conceptualization of the path of meditation,

original: mi slob pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: and the conceptualization of the path of no more learning.

original: gsum par ni gang zag la dmigs pa'i 'dzin pa po'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa dgu spong ste /
analyzed: gsum par ni gang zag la dmigs pa'i 'dzin pa po'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa dgu spong ste /
translated: In the third, one abandons the nine types of conceptualization that are the apprehender that focuses on the person.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rang gi rgyud kyi bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag gcig pu nyid dang / rgyu'i bdag dang / lta ba po yang bdag yin pa dang / de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa 'dzin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag gcig pu nyid dang / rgyu'i bdag dang / lta ba po yang bdag yin pa dang / de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa 'dzin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dzin pa dang /
translated: the conceptualization called the apprehension of a self in one's continuum, the conceptualization of a single self, the conceptualization of a self that is a cause, the conceptualization of a self that is a seer, the conceptualization of a self that is an enjoyer, the conceptualization of a self that is an experiencer, the conceptualization of a self that is an agent, the conceptualization of a self that is a controller, and the conceptualization of a self that is a refiner.

original: mthong ba 'dzin pa dang / bsgom pa 'dzin pa dang / don byas pa nyid 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba 'dzin pa dang / bsgom pa 'dzin pa dang / don byas pa nyid 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: the conceptualization of grasping the view, the conceptualization of grasping meditation, and the conceptualization of grasping the accomplishment of the goal.

original: bzhi par ni brtags pa'i skyes bu la gnas pa'i 'dzin pa po'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu spong ste /
analyzed: bzhi par ni brtags pa'i skyes bu la gnas pa'i 'dzin pa po'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu spong ste /
translated: In the fourth, one abandons the second group of nine conceptualizations, which are the conceptualizations of the grasper that are based on the imagined person.

original: de la phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams nyid la 'dzin pa po nyid du rnam par rtog pa nyid dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par byang bar brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: de la phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams nyid la 'dzin pa po nyid du rnam par rtog pa nyid dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par byang bar brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: Therein, the conceptualization of the aggregates, sense spheres, and elements as the grasper, the conceptualization of the imagined dependent origination, the conceptualization of the imagined purification,

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang / khyad par dang mi slob pa'i lam du brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang / khyad par dang mi slob pa'i lam du brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: and the conceptualization of the imagined paths of seeing, meditation, distinction, and no more learning.

original: de dag ni sbyor ba lhan cig thob pa'i ye shes kyi me'i khyad par du rtogs pas me dang 'dra ba'i sems bskyed pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sbyor ba lhan cig thob pa'i ye shes kyi me'i khyad par du rtogs pas me dang 'dra ba'i sems bskyed pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: These are the fourth generation of the bodhicitta fire, which is similar to the fire of the wisdom of the simultaneously attained application.

original: gnas skabs 'dir ni rnal 'byor pa'i mos pa gtsor gyur pa nyid dang / ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan gyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i mos pas spyod ba'i sa zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'dir ni rnal 'byor pa'i mos pa gtsor gyur pa nyid dang / ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan gyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i mos pas spyod ba'i sa zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: At this stage, the bodhisattva's faith is the most important thing, and it is the basis of the qualities that will be explained. Therefore, this stage is called the stage of action through faith.

original: de ltar gong nas gong du yon tan gyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis zag pa med pa'i sa bcu gcig yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gong nas gong du yon tan gyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis zag pa med pa'i sa bcu gcig yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the eleven stages are the basis of the qualities that are higher and higher.

original: de las kyang ni rgyu'i gnas skabs //
analyzed: de las kyang ni rgyu'i gnas skabs //
translated: And from that, the stage of cause,

original: pha rol phyin bcu'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu'i bdag nyid can //
translated: which has the nature of the ten perfections,

original: de las gzhan pa bsgom bdag can //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa bsgom bdag can //
translated: and the other, which has the nature of meditation.

original: sems bskyed pa dang po ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin can yin pas de skyes pa na rnal 'byor ba nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang po ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin can yin pas de skyes pa na rnal 'byor ba nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the first production of the thought of enlightenment has the nature of the path of insight, when it is produced, the yogin abandons the one hundred and twelve afflictions.

original: de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa @67b dang ; lam re re zhing spang bar bya ba bcu bcu yod pas na bzhi bcu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa @67b dang ; lam re re zhing spang bar bya ba bcu bcu yod pas na bzhi bcu'o //
translated: There are ten objects to be abandoned for each of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path in the desire realm, thus there are forty.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi khong khro ba bzhi bton na bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi khong khro ba bzhi bton na bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Similarly, if the four types of anger in the form and formless realms are excluded, there are seventy two.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sa dgu po ni bsgom pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sa dgu po ni bsgom pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
translated: The other nine levels are the nature of meditation.

original: de rnams su bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba nyid bcu drug spong ba ni /
analyzed: de rnams su bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba nyid bcu drug spong ba ni /
translated: Abandoning the objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: on those levels is as follows.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang log par lta ba ni lhan cig skyes pa dang / 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa ste gong ma'i khong khro ba ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang log par lta ba ni lhan cig skyes pa dang / 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa ste gong ma'i khong khro ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: On the first two formless states, there are four objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation: the innate afflicted view of the self, wrong view, desire realm attachment, and anger.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis spangs pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang phyug tu gyur kyang ji srid ltung ba phra mo rnams la shes bzhin du gnas par gyur par mi nus pa de srid sa dang po'i sems bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis spangs pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang phyug tu gyur kyang ji srid ltung ba phra mo rnams la shes bzhin du gnas par gyur par mi nus pa de srid sa dang po'i sems bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the first stage of thought is that of the one who has abandoned the one hundred and two afflictions and has become the lord of Jambudvipa, but who is not yet able to abide in the knowledge of the subtle downfalls.

original: sems can tshad med pa'i sems kyi rgyud tshim par mdzad pas kun du 'dzin par spyod pas gter chen po dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa'i sems kyi rgyud tshim par mdzad pas kun du 'dzin par spyod pas gter chen po dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The second stage is that of the one who is like a great treasure, because he satisfies the mental continuums of immeasurable sentient beings and acts as their universal support.

original: ltung ba phra mo'i dri ma spong bar nus pa nyid kyis na sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba phra mo'i dri ma spong bar nus pa nyid kyis na sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa'o //
translated: The second stage, the Stainless, is so called because it is the stage at which one is able to abandon the stains of the subtle downfalls.

original: de yang gling bzhi pa'i dbang phyug tu gyur kyang ji srid 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par mi nus pa de srid du ni sa gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gling bzhi pa'i dbang phyug tu gyur kyang ji srid 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par mi nus pa de srid du ni sa gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second stage is that of the one who has become the lord of the four continents, but who is not yet able to enter into the meditative absorptions of all worldly beings.

original: de ni thams cad rin thang med pa'i rin po che rnams de las 'byung bar byed pa yin pas rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ni thams cad rin thang med pa'i rin po che rnams de las 'byung bar byed pa yin pas rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a mine of jewels, since it produces all the jewels of the transcendences, which are priceless.

original: de nus na ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu thob pas gsum po 'od byed pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: de nus na ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu thob pas gsum po 'od byed pa'i sa'o //
translated: If one is able to do that, then by the attainment of the power of concentration, the third stage is the Radiant.

original: de sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i bdag por gyur kyang ji srid byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom par mi nus pa na /
analyzed: de sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i bdag por gyur kyang ji srid byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom par mi nus pa na /
translated: Even though one becomes lord of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, as long as one is unable to cultivate the factors of enlightenment,

original: mi sdug pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad kyis mi bskyod pas rgya mtsho chen po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad kyis mi bskyod pas rgya mtsho chen po dang 'dra'o //
translated: one is like a great ocean, since one is unshaken by all the troubles of foulness.

original: nub par gyur nas ni de'i mthus sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba yin no //
analyzed: nub par gyur nas ni de'i mthus sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba yin no //
translated: Having gone down, by the power of that, the fourth stage is the Blazing.üîΩEven though one becomes lord of the YƒÅma gods, as long as one is unable to cultivate the truths,

original: de 'thab bral gyi bdag por gyur kyang ji srid bden pa bsgom par mi nus pa na de yang dag pa'i shes pa la brtan pas mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de 'thab bral gyi bdag por gyur kyang ji srid bden pa bsgom par mi nus pa na de yang dag pa'i shes pa la brtan pas mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje dang 'dra'o //
translated: one is like a diamond, since one is unbreakable by wrong knowledge.

original: nus par gyur nas bdud thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pas na sa lnga pa sbyang dka' ba'o //üîΩde dga' ldan gyi bdag por gyur kyang ji srid mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa lhun gyis grub par 'jug mi nus pa de srid dmigs pa thams cad rnam par @68a * //
analyzed: nus par gyur nas bdud thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pas na sa lnga pa sbyang dka' ba'o // de dga' ldan gyi bdag por gyur kyang ji srid mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa lhun gyis grub par 'jug mi nus pa de srid dmigs pa thams cad rnam par @68a * //
translated: Having become capable, he is not overcome by any demons, so it is the fifth stage, Difficult to Conquer.

original: g-yeng bas bsgrub par mi nus pas ni ri bo dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: g-yeng bas bsgrub par mi nus pas ni ri bo dang 'dra'o //
translated: Even though he has become the lord of the Tushita gods, as long as he is unable to enter spontaneously into the cultivation of signlessness, he is unable to practice because of the distraction of all objects, so it is like a mountain.

original: nub par gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pas na drug pa mngon du gyur pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: nub par gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pas na drug pa mngon du gyur pa'i sa'o //
translated: Having become capable, he is able to enter spontaneously into the cultivation of signlessness, so it is the sixth stage, Actualization.

original: de 'phrul dga'i lha'i rgyal por gyur kyang de srid glags skabs med par bsgom mi nus pa de srid de sgrib pa gnyis kyis nad rab tu zhi bar byed pas na sman dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de 'phrul dga'i lha'i rgyal por gyur kyang de srid glags skabs med par bsgom mi nus pa de srid de sgrib pa gnyis kyis nad rab tu zhi bar byed pas na sman dang 'dra'o //
translated: Even though he has become the lord of the gods of Enjoying Emanations, as long as he is unable to cultivate without interruption, he is like medicine, because he is able to pacify the two obstructions.

original: de yan chad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi bdag nyid can yin pas shes rab nyid khyad par can gyi rnam par 'jug pa na thabs dang smon lam stobs dang ye shes so //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi bdag nyid can yin pas shes rab nyid khyad par can gyi rnam par 'jug pa na thabs dang smon lam stobs dang ye shes so //
translated: The four perfections up to this point are as follows: since wisdom is the nature of the first four perfections, wisdom itself is engaged in a special way as method, aspiration, strength, and intuition.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i bsgom pa dang / bar skabs med par bsgom par nus par gyur pa na lam la 'bad pa med pa'i thabs dang 'byor pas ring du song ba'i phyir sa bdun pa ring du song ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i bsgom pa dang / bar skabs med par bsgom par nus par gyur pa na lam la 'bad pa med pa'i thabs dang 'byor pas ring du song ba'i phyir sa bdun pa ring du song ba'o //
translated: When one is able to cultivate the signless and the wishless, the seventh stage is Gone Afar, because one has gone afar by the method and the power of the path without effort.

original: de gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bdag por gyur kyang ji srid lhun gyis grub par 'jug par mi nus pa de srid de gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi spong bas mdza' bo dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bdag por gyur kyang ji srid lhun gyis grub par 'jug par mi nus pa de srid de gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi spong bas mdza' bo dang mtshungs so //
translated: Even though one has become the lord of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods, as long as one is not able to enter into the signless and wishless spontaneously, one does not abandon the welfare of sentient beings in all situations, and so one is like a friend.

original: de nus par gyur nas mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pas mi g-yo ba nyid kyis na sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba'o //

analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams kyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi de kho na nyid bskyed du zin kyang ji srid rab tu dga' ba'i sa ma thob pa de srid rdo rje lta bu'i de kho na nyid yid la byed pa med pas phyir mi ldog pa ma

translated: However, after the division of the elements and sense bases is abandoned, the object of all is explained as the division of the material and the immaterial.

original: do // de nyid la ni nges rgyu can //
analyzed: do // de nyid la ni nges rgyu can //

analyzed: gang la yang yod pa ma yin gyi /

analyzed: de las go bzlog pa ma nges pa tsam nyid ni 'khor ba pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang rjes su mthun pa'i bstan bcos mnyan pa dang / dpyad pa bdag gis thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin can gyis shes rab bskyed la /
translated: Then, having generated the wisdom which has the nature of hearing and examining the treatise which is in accord with the four noble truths,

original: bsgom pa la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩde yang / chul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pas //üîΩbsgom pa la ni rab sbyar bya //
analyzed: bsgom pa la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o // de yang / chul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pas // bsgom pa la ni rab sbyar bya //
translated: one should apply oneself to meditation.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: And that is explained:üîΩOne who abides in the method, endowed with hearing and reflection,üîΩshould apply himself to meditation.

original: de nas bsgom pa la sbyar ba'i dus su dam pa ma yin pa dang 'dres pa dang / rnam par rtog pa yongs su spangs pas lus dang sems nye bar sdud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bsgom pa la sbyar ba'i dus su dam pa ma yin pa dang 'dres pa dang / rnam par rtog pa yongs su spangs pas lus dang sems nye bar sdud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, at the time of applying oneself to meditation, one should gather the body and mind by avoiding the unwholesome and by abandoning discursive thought.

original: de ltar lus dang sems nye bar sdud pa yang chog shes pa dang / 'dod pa chung bar 'gyur gyi 'dod pa che ba dang chog mi shes pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lus dang sems nye bar sdud pa yang chog shes pa dang / 'dod pa chung bar 'gyur gyi 'dod pa che ba dang chog mi shes pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the body and mind are withdrawn, and one becomes content and has few desires, not those who have great desires and are discontented.

original: de yang 'dod pa che ba dang / chog mi shes pa las nye bar sdud pa gnyis dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa che ba dang / chog mi shes pa las nye bar sdud pa gnyis dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And those who have great desires and are discontented do not have the two withdrawals.

original: de yang 'dod chags la spyod pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa rnam pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags la spyod pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa rnam pa gnyis yod do //
translated: Moreover, there are two kinds of persons: those who are dominated by passion and those who are dominated by discursiveness.

original: de la 'dod chags la spyod pas ni dang por sems mnyam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir mi gtsang ba bsgam par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la spyod pas ni dang por sems mnyam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir mi gtsang ba bsgam par bya'o //
translated: Among them, one who is dominated by passion should first cultivate the impurity meditation in order to settle the mind in equipoise.

original: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pas ni dbugs rdub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o //üîΩde yang / de la 'jug pa mi gtsang ba 'am /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pas ni dbugs rdub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o // de yang / de la 'jug pa mi gtsang ba 'am /
translated: One who is dominated by discursiveness should cultivate mindfulness of the inhalation and exhalation of the breath.üîΩMoreover, it is said:

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rdub pa dran pas so zhes bshad pa @72a * //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rdub pa dran pas so zhes bshad pa @72a * //
translated: One enters that by means of impurity or mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: yin no // de nas zhi gnas thob par gyur nas ni //
analyzed: yin no // de nas zhi gnas thob par gyur nas ni //
translated: Then, having attained serenity,

original: lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang / chos rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang / chos rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: Mindfulness of the body, of sensation, of thought, and of the factors.

original: rjes dran bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes dran bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: de rnams kyi bsgom pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la yongs su brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bsgom pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la yongs su brtag pa'o //
translated: Their cultivation is the thorough investigation of their general and specific characteristics.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: Among them, the specific characteristic

original: gzugs su rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: is what is called ‚Äúcapable of materiality,‚Äù etc.üîΩThe general characteristic is what is called ‚Äúempty,‚Äù ‚Äúnonself,‚Äù etc.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa dang bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa dang bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And it is said:

original: de yang / zhig nas thob par gyur nas ni //
analyzed: de yang / zhig nas thob par gyur nas ni //
translated: Having attained it after destruction,

original: lus dang tshor ba sems chos kyis //üîΩmtshan nyid gnyis ni yongs brtags pas //
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba sems chos kyis // mtshan nyid gnyis ni yongs brtags pas //
translated: through the body, sensation, thought, and factors,üîΩone should cultivate the foundations of mindfulness

original: dran pa nyer gzhag bsgom par bya ;üîΩ/ zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag bsgom par bya ; / zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: through the thorough investigation of the two characteristics.

original: de ltar mi gtsang ba dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang rdub pa rjes su dran pa'i sbyor ba la bslabs pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rigs dang ldan pa dag 'di rjes su dran pa na 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mi gtsang ba dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang rdub pa rjes su dran pa'i sbyor ba la bslabs pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rigs dang ldan pa dag 'di rjes su dran pa na 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, through training in the application of mindfulness of impurity and of inhalation and exhalation, one enters into the mindfulness of these when one recollects those that have the same specific nature.

original: de yang mi gtsang bar 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de yang mi gtsang bar 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the antidote to the error of conceiving the body as pure.

original: de nas tshor ba rjes su dran pa la ste de yang sdug bsngal bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de nas tshor ba rjes su dran pa la ste de yang sdug bsngal bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Next, one recollects feeling, and that is the antidote to the error of conceiving suffering as happiness.

original: de nas yang sems rjes su dran pa la ste /
analyzed: de nas yang sems rjes su dran pa la ste /
translated: Next, one recollects mind.

original: de yang mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: That is the antidote to the error of conceiving the impermanent as permanent.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu chos rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu chos rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: Next, one recollects phenomena.

original: de yang dad pa la sogs pa'i chos tsam du dmigs pas bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po yin pa de bas na phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dad pa la sogs pa'i chos tsam du dmigs pas bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po yin pa de bas na phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since one observes phenomena such as faith and so on as mere phenomena, it is the antidote to the error of conceiving a self in the absence of a self. Therefore it is said to be the antidote to the four errors.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na chos zhes bya bas phung po lnga la dmigs pa nyid chos rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na chos zhes bya bas phung po lnga la dmigs pa nyid chos rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: When one observes the five aggregates, it is the recollection of phenomena, since one apprehends them as phenomena through apprehending their own characteristics.

original: de'i tshe chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i chos rjes su dran pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam par chos thams cad bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i chos rjes su dran pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam par chos thams cad bsgom pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the mindfulness of dharmas that takes all dharmas as its object is the cultivation of all dharmas in the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self.

original: de bas na /üîΩchos kun dran pa nyer gzhag par //
analyzed: de bas na / chos kun dran pa nyer gzhag par //
translated: Therefore,üîΩit is said:üîΩThe mindfulness of all dharmas

original: ma lus dmigs pa la gnas pa'i//üîΩmi rtag sdug bsngal stong pa dang // bdag med de ni rnam thar mthong //
analyzed: ma lus dmigs pa la gnas pa'i// mi rtag sdug bsngal stong pa dang // bdag med de ni rnam thar mthong //
translated: is the observation of all objects,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self, which is the seeing of liberation.

original: de nas phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis me'i snga rtags gtsub shing gi me'i sngon du dro ba 'byung ba dang 'dra ba'i drod du gtogs pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de nas phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis me'i snga rtags gtsub shing gi me'i sngon du dro ba 'byung ba dang 'dra ba'i drod du gtogs pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha skyed par byed do //
translated: Later, the arising of the noble path generates the factors conducive to penetration that belong to the stage of heat, which is like the heat that precedes the fire of the friction board, which is a sign of fire.

original: @72b de bden pa bzhi'i yul la rnam pa bcu drug tu dmigs la /
analyzed: @72b de bden pa bzhi'i yul la rnam pa bcu drug tu dmigs la /
translated: That [heat] observes the objects of the four truths in sixteen aspects.

original: de nas yang rtse mor gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang rtse mor gtogs pa ste /
translated: Then, it is the peak,

original: de dang 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: which is similar to that.

original: de nas kyang bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas kyang bzod pa'o //
translated: Then, it is acceptance.

original: de nas bzod pa las chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: de nas bzod pa las chos kyi mchog go //
translated: Then, after the stage of receptivity, there is the supreme mundane state.

original: 'di dag ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //üîΩde yang / de ltar nges 'byed cha bzhi po //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no // de yang / de ltar nges 'byed cha bzhi po //
translated: These are the four stages of ascertainment, which are by nature the roots of virtue.

original: bsgom pa rang bzhin can zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa rang bzhin can zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: And these are said to be the nature of meditation.

original: 'di tsam ni sbyor ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam ni sbyor ba'i lam yin no //
translated: This much is the path of preparation.

original: de yan chad 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam pa bzhi'i yul la skad cig ma bcu drug can gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pas zag pa med pa mngon par rtogs pa skye bar zad do //
analyzed: de yan chad 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam pa bzhi'i yul la skad cig ma bcu drug can gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pas zag pa med pa mngon par rtogs pa skye bar zad do //
translated: Beyond that, the clear realization of the truths arises, which has sixteen aspects and is the clear realization of the uncontaminated state that is the object of the four noble truths.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su chos shes pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su chos shes pa ste /
translated: receptivity to the knowledge of the phenomena of suffering, the knowledge of the phenomena of suffering, receptivity to the subsequent knowledge of suffering, and the subsequent knowledge of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa'i skad cig ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa'i skad cig ma bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four moments that focus on the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the truths of origin, cessation, and path.

original: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa'i skad cig ma brgyad ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin no //üîΩrjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i chos shes pa'i skad cig ma brgyad ni /
analyzed: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa'i skad cig ma brgyad ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin no // rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i chos shes pa'i skad cig ma brgyad ni /
translated: The eight moments of the receptivity to the cognition of the dharma and the cognition of the dharma are the antidote to the afflictions of the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: The eight moments of the receptivity to the subsequent cognition and the subsequent cognition are the antidote to the afflictions of the form and formless realms.üîΩAnd it is said:

original: de yang / 'jig rten pa yi chos mchog las //üîΩchos shes bzod pa zag pa med //
analyzed: de yang / 'jig rten pa yi chos mchog las // chos shes bzod pa zag pa med //
translated: From the supreme mundane state,

original: ces bshad pa yin no //üîΩde la lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i skad cig ma yongs su spangs nas /
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no // de la lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i skad cig ma yongs su spangs nas /
translated: the receptivity to the cognition of the dharma is uncontaminated.

original: de yan chad ni mthong ba'i lam yin te rjes su rtogs pa shes pa nyid ni mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yan chad ni mthong ba'i lam yin te rjes su rtogs pa shes pa nyid ni mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The moment of the subsequent cognition of the path is the path of seeing, because the subsequent cognition itself is the complete path of seeing.

original: sems skad cig ma bcu drug pa la ni shes par bya ba sngon med pa yod par 'dod kyi mthong bar bya ba ni med de bzod pa nyid mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems skad cig ma bcu drug pa la ni shes par bya ba sngon med pa yod par 'dod kyi mthong bar bya ba ni med de bzod pa nyid mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sixteenth moment of thought is the path of cultivation, because there is nothing more to be known that has not already been known. But there is nothing more to be seen, because perseverance itself has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the subsequent knowledge that is included in the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam yang dag par bsdus pa'i lam gyi rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yang dag par bsdus pa'i lam gyi rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las gsal bar bya ste /
translated: It is called the path of cultivation because one cultivates that which has been seen.üîΩIt is said:

original: de yang / ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //üîΩder ni skad cig @73a * //
analyzed: de yang / ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam // der ni skad cig @73a * //
translated: Because one sees what has not been seen, it is the path of seeing.

original: bco lnga'o // zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bco lnga'o // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is fifteen moments.

original: de la bzod pa'i skad cig ma de nyid nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pas bar chad med pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de la bzod pa'i skad cig ma de nyid nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pas bar chad med pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: In this, the moment of perseverance is the nature of the uninterrupted path, because it abandons the afflictions.

original: shes pa'i skad cig ma ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa'i skad cig ma ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The moment of knowledge is the nature of the liberated path.

original: nyon mongs pa yang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang mdor bsdu na /
translated: The afflictions are also summarized as follows.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dbye bas rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dbye bas rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are fivefold by way of the classification of objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, path and meditation.

original: de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
translated: There are ten objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering:üîΩthe five views such as attachment, anger, pride, ignorance and doubt, and the five such as the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, wrong view, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme and

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom ste lnga dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /üîΩtshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang lnga ste bcu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom ste lnga dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang lnga ste bcu'o //
translated: clinging to false views as supreme.

original: kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni bdun te /
analyzed: kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni bdun te /
translated: There are seven objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of origin and cessation:

original: de dag nyid las 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa gong ma rnams so //
analyzed: de dag nyid las 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa gong ma rnams so //
translated: those same five views except for the afflicted view of the self, extreme view and clinging to rules and ritual as supreme.

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni brgyad de /
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni brgyad de /
translated: There are eight objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path:

original: bdun po de dag nyid dang tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin par blta'o //
analyzed: bdun po de dag nyid dang tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin par blta'o //
translated: The seven are the same as the above, plus the overesteeming of morality and ascetic practices.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth is abandoned by cultivation.

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi yin no //
translated: There are four: attachment, hostility, pride, and ignorance. These are in the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag la yang de dag nyid las thams cad du khong khro ba bton pa lhag ma gsum mo //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag la yang de dag nyid las thams cad du khong khro ba bton pa lhag ma gsum mo //
translated: In the form and formless realms, there are three each, excluding hostility.

original: de nyid kyis na nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are ninety eight afflictions.

original: de yang / de dag bcu dang bdun bdun brgyad //
analyzed: de yang / de dag bcu dang bdun bdun brgyad //
translated: They are ten, seven, seven, and eight

original: lta ba gsum gnyis ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: lta ba gsum gnyis ma gtogs pa //
translated: , excluding three views and two views.

original: 'dod na sdug bsngal la sogs pa //
analyzed: 'dod na sdug bsngal la sogs pa //
translated: In the desire realm, the four truths

original: mthong bas rim bzhin spong bar byed //
analyzed: mthong bas rim bzhin spong bar byed //
translated: are seen in order, abandoning nine,üîΩsix, seven, and eight afflictions.

original: bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bya yin //
analyzed: bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bya yin //
translated: Four are objects abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: khong khrom gtogs de dag nyid //
analyzed: khong khrom gtogs de dag nyid //
translated: Those same afflictions, excluding hostility,

original: gzugs khams gzugs med de dang 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs khams gzugs med de dang 'dra //
translated: are in the form realm and formless realm.

original: de ltar dgu bcu rtsa brgyad 'dod //
analyzed: de ltar dgu bcu rtsa brgyad 'dod //
translated: Thus ninety eight are asserted.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: de la 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi rjes thogs la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal @73b bcu'i thob ba spong ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi rjes thogs la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal @73b bcu'i thob ba spong ste /
translated: Immediately after the supreme mundane state, when perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, one abandons obtainment of the truth of suffering that is experienced in the desire realm.

original: de yang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can yin pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can yin pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is the nature of wisdom, it is the nature of seeing the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa spang ba bzod pas yongs su mthong ba'i sdug bsngal la nges pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa spang ba bzod pas yongs su mthong ba'i sdug bsngal la nges pa'i bdag nyid yin te /

analyzed: de yang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang thob pa lhan cig skye ba yin no //
translated: It also arises simultaneously with its concomitant states and obtainment.

original: de ltar na bzod pa thams cad ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na bzod pa thams cad ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin la /

original: shes pa rnams ni nges pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni nges pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /

original: 'di gnyis kyis rkun po 'byin pa dang sgo gtan 'dzud pa'i tshul du nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis rkun po 'byin pa dang sgo gtan 'dzud pa'i tshul du nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar byed do //

original: de bzhin sdug bsngal la rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bco brgyad kyi thob pa spong bar byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin sdug bsngal la rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bco brgyad kyi thob pa spong bar byed la /

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Knowledge of the truth of suffering also arises simultaneously with the obtainment of that which is concomitant with it.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na de'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bdun gyi thob pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na de'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bdun gyi thob pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin arises, it abandons the obtainment of the seven afflictions of the desire realm level that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: chos shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: kun 'byung ba rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na de'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas gong ma pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When subsequent perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin arises, it abandons the obtainment of the affliction that is to be abandoned by that perseverance.

original: nyon mongs pa'i thob pa bcu gnyis spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i thob pa bcu gnyis spong bar 'gyur la /

original: rjes su shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Subsequent knowledge also arises simultaneously with the obtainment of that which is concomitant with it.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bar 'gyur ba de'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i bdun gyi thob pa spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bar 'gyur ba de'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i bdun gyi thob pa spong bar 'gyur la /

original: chos shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na /

analyzed: de'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gong ma bcu gnyis kyi thob pa spong bar 'gyur la /

original: rjes su chos shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩlam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba de'i spang bar bya @74a * //
analyzed: rjes su chos shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro // lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba de'i spang bar bya @74a * //

original: ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa brgyad spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa brgyad spong bar 'gyur la /

original: chos shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos shes pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na de'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas gong ma pa bcu bzhi'i thob pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path arises, it abandons the acquisition of the fourteen afflictions that are to be abandoned by that perseverance.

analyzed: 'di tsam gyis lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i rgyu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: sa dgu yin no //

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dgur dbye ba dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sa rnams kyi 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa yang re re zhing dgu dgur dbye ste /

analyzed: de ltar byas na sa'i rnam pa'i dbye bas brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur te /

analyzed: rnam pa 'di nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam yang brgyad cu rtsa gcig nyid yin no //

analyzed: de yang / sa dang sa la nyes rnam dgu //

analyzed: de bzhin du ni yon tan rnams // chung dang 'bring dang che rnams kyi //

analyzed: chung ngu la sogs tha dad phyir //

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference is this.

original: sa re re zhing nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang po chen po chen po'i nas tha ma chung du chung du'i bar nyid la lam gyi rnam pa yang /
analyzed: sa re re zhing nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang po chen po chen po'i nas tha ma chung du chung du'i bar nyid la lam gyi rnam pa yang /

original: dang po ni chung ngu'i chung du yin la /
analyzed: dang po ni chung ngu'i chung du yin la /
translated: The first is the small of the small.

original: tha ma ni chen po'i chen po yin no //
analyzed: tha ma ni chen po'i chen po yin no //
translated: The last is the great of the great.

original: de yang gang gi phyir de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa mthong ba rnams la yang dang yang du rtsol bas bsgom pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa mthong ba rnams la yang dang yang du rtsol bas bsgom pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, since it is cultivated through repeated effort by those who have seen the truth of suffering, etc.,

analyzed: rtsol ba yang dang po ma @74b goms pa'i gnas skabs su ni chung ngu'i chung ngu nyid skye bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: de nyid kyis na nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po lam gyi rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngus spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: By that, the great of the great aspect of the truth of suffering is abandoned by the small of the small path,

original: chung ngu'i chung ngu ni chen po'i chen bos spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung ngu ni chen po'i chen bos spong bar 'gyur te /

translated: This should be understood as the method of the washerman‚Äôs cloth.

translated: In this regard, it should be understood that each of these one hundred and eight aspects of the path is the nature of the uninterrupted path and the path of liberation, when one abandons each of those aspects of the afflictions.

analyzed: de la gang 'dod par gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga spang ba'i bar ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i rgyu la zhugs pa yin la /
